heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Indicates Model 3 Production On Upswing
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has hit a rough patch in recent weeks due to a number of different issues, and there continue to be concerns about whether or not the company will be able to reach its ambitious production goals. According to an email from CEO Elon Musk, progress has been made on that front. more
Jalopnik passes along what the Tesla CEO had to say.
“If things go as planned today, we will comfortably exceed that number over a seven day period!” Musk wrote in the email, obtained by Jalopnik.
The message suggests the company rapidly exceeded production of the Model 3 over the past week. Bloomberg, which has been tracking production totals for the all-electric sedan, said over the weekend that Tesla had been hitting around 1,200 per week.
Musk was referring to the 2,000 vehicle per week rate, which would be a welcome surprise in the face of the report from Bloomberg. Ever the optimist, Musk would go on to explain that nothing but blue skies are ahead if the company continues on this track.
“This is already double the pace of 2017!” he added. “By the end of the year, I believe we will be producing vehicle sat least four times faster than last year.”

heading: Latest Tesla Inc (TSLA) Decline Presenting Opportunity For Yet Another Bounce? (TSLA)
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) had a rough week last week, but the electric automaker’s shares could be preparing for yet another comeback.more
That’s according to CNBC, which points out that similar conditions have produced good returns before:
In the last two days, Tesla shares have fallen 15.3 percent. Such a two-day loss has occurred only six times since the electric car maker’s IPO in 2010.
A week after those losses, it returned an average of 3.96 percent, trading positively about 67 percent of the time, according to Kensho, a hedge fund analytics tool. However, if one looks at the individual instances that go into that average, the swings are notable…
The latest of those such bounces happened in February 2016, with a 4.85% return in the ensuing week. Tesla also saw bounces of 12% and 17% in 2013 and 2012 following similar two-day declines. However, the stock also fell 1.55% in the week following a big two-day loss in 2013, and 11.2% in 2010 during a similar setup.
Whether Tesla will see a big bounce or a continued meltdown this week remains to be seen, but the past paints an overall bullish picture for the stock.
Tesla Inc shares fell $7.88 (-2.96%) in premarket trading Monday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -14.52%, versus a -1.00% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Admits Autopilot Involved In Fatal Crash, But Driver Still At Fault
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) this week revealed more details about a recent fatal car crash that involved its self-driving system, Autopilot.more
Specifically, TSLA noted that the driver involved failed to heed the vehicle’s repeated warnings to assume control and steer away from danger.
“The driver had received several visual and one audible hands-on warning earlier in the drive and the driver’s hands were not detected on the wheel for six seconds prior to the collision,” the electric automaker wrote in a blog post. “The driver had about five seconds and 150 meters of unobstructed view of the concrete divider with the crushed crash attenuator, but the vehicle logs show that no action was taken.”
TechCrunch provides some more details on exactly what went wrong here:
The promise of Tesla’s Autopilot system is to reduce car accidents. In the company’s blog post, Tesla notes Autopilot reduces crash rates by 40 percent, according to an independent review by the U.S. government. Of course, that does not mean the technology is perfect in preventing all accidents.
As Tesla previously noted, the crash was so severe because the middle divider on the highway had been damaged in an earlier accident. Tesla also cautioned that Autopilot does not prevent all accidents, but it does make them less likely to occur.
It hasn’t been a good month for self-driving systems. Uber shut down its entire autonomous driving fleet recently after one of its self-driving cars hit and killed a pedestrian in Tempe, Arizona. The victim’s family has since settled a lawsuit with Uber.
Tesla Inc shares closed at $266.13 on Thursday, up $8.35 (+3.24%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -14.52%, versus a -1.00% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Recalls 123,000 Model S Sedans
body:
If you own a Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) Model S sedan, odds are you’ll be caught up in the electric automaker’s latest recall.more
As Bloomberg reports, Elon Musk’s embattled EV maker announced a massive recall this week to fix a steering part:
Tesla Inc. is recalling all Model S cars built before April 2016 to retrofit a power-steering component as the company caps its worst one-month performance in the stock market since December 2010.
The issue, which the carmaker said has not led to any accidents or injuries, impacts only the flagship Model S sedan, not the Model X sport utility vehicle or more affordable Model 3. The recall affects roughly 123,000 vehicles globally.
In am email sent to affected owners, the company said it’s making the move due to “excessive corrosion in the power steering bolts, though only in very cold climates, particularly those that frequently use calcium or magnesium road salts.”
“Nonetheless, Tesla plans to replace all early Model S power steering bolts in all climates worldwide to account for the possibility that the vehicle may later be used in a highly corrosive environment,” the email read.
Tesla Inc shares closed at $266.13 on Thursday, up $8.35 (+3.24%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -14.52%, versus a -1.00% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Makes Major Push To Ramp Up Model 3 Production
body:
There have been plenty of concerns making the rounds about whether or not Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) will be able to meet its ambitious production goals, and reports indicate the company is making a major push to make sure that it does as a result. Tesla is pulling out a number of stops to roll Model 3’s off of the assembly line, but that will temporarily come at the expense of Model S and Model X production. more
Bloomberg has the scoop on Tesla’s production push.
Tesla Inc. exhorted its factory workers to disprove the “haters” betting against the company wrong and asked for volunteers to join the effort to ramp up output of the crucial Model 3 line.
In a pair of internal memos last week, the heads of engineering and production spelled out measures to free up workers for the Model 3 line and challenged them to reach production goals. Doug Field, the engineering chief, told staff that if they can exceed 300 Model 3s a day, it would be an “incredible victory” at a time when short-sellers and critics are increasingly doubting the company’s ability to fulfill CEO Elon Musk’s vision of building a mass-production electric-vehicle manufacturer.
Bloomberg was able to get a look at an email that Field sent to staff last week, and it’s quite clear that he’s taking the scuttlebutt about the company’s production shortcomings personally. “I find that personally insulting, and you should too,” he wrote. “Let’s make them regret ever betting against us. You will prove a bunch of haters wrong.”
Tesla will suspend production of the Model S and Model X in the final days of the quarter to help reach its Model 3 goals, but the company notes that its ahead of schedule on the other models for the quarter.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $262.62 per share on Thursday afternoon, up $4.84 (+1.88%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -15.65%, versus a -0.50% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Germany Will Offer Tesla Inc (TSLA) Model S Subsidies
body:
Back in December, Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) was removed from the list of vehicles eligible for subsidies in Germany. It appears as if the row has been resolved, as the German Federal Office for Economic Affairs and Export Controls has returned Tesla to the list of eligible vehicles. more
Reuters has the details on what that means for Tesla.
Tesla (TSLA.O) buyers in Germany can apply for subsidies again because a government agency has ended its dispute with the U.S. carmaker over whether its Model S was too expensive to qualify for the incentives scheme.
An independent assessment proved that a base version of the Model S was available for less than the 60,000 euros ($74,000) baseline and the cars are thus eligible, the German Federal Office for Economic Affairs and Export Controls (BAFA) told Reuters.
The move to take Tesla off of the subsidy list was unexpected to begin with. BAFA contended that the vehicles were too expensive to qualify, but Tesla denied that assessment.
An independent review was able to prove that Tesla was correct, and German customers are now eligible for subsidies once again.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $253.50 per share on Thursday morning, down $4.28 (-1.66%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -18.58%, versus a -1.63% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Analyst: Robots, Automation Are Killing Tesla Inc's (TSLA) Productivity
body:
A steady stream of negative news has been coming out on Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) this week, and that’s led to additional speculation about what may be ailing the company as a whole. According to Max Warburton, European autos analyst at Bernstein, the problem may lie with the view from the top.    more
CNBC passes along Warburton’s take on Tesla.
Tesla CEO Elon Musk is so focused on automating electric car manufacturing that it’s hurting the company’s ability to deliver on its Model 3 production goals, Bernstein said Wednesday.
“When it comes to auto production, Elon may have fallen in love with the wrong thing. He’s fallen in love with robots and automation,” Max Warburton, European autos analyst at Bernstein, said in a Wednesday report.
Warburton notes that there has been plenty of research done on automation, and he points out that the research reveals that the results of employing the concept are often in stark contrast to the principles of lean production. He’s a little confused as to why the company seems to be neglecting those findings.
“It appears [as] though Tesla has chosen to ignore it,” he said. “Or perhaps Tesla is convinced it’s out of date, in an age of better sensors and computers.”
Tesla Inc shares rose $2.77 (+1.07%) in premarket trading Thursday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -17.21%, versus a -2.24% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Investor Lawsuit Against Tesla Inc (TSLA) Can Proceed, Judge Rules
body:
It appears that Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) investors miffed at the electric automaker’s acquisition of SolarCity will finally have their day in court.more
As Bloomberg reports, a key ruling was handed down this week that allows a major class action lawsuit to proceed:
Tesla Inc. investors can press forward with claims that billionaire founder Elon Musk duped them into backing his $2.6 billion buyout of a solar-energy firm founded by his cousins, another setback in a rough week for the automaker.
Tesla shareholders challenging the acquisition of SolarCity Corp. produced enough evidence showing the deal may have been flawed by conflicts among Musk and other company directors, a Delaware judge ruled Wednesday. More than 85 percent of the company’s stockholders voted to back the acquistion.
Tesla said it disagrees with the judge’s decision, and will take whatever steps it can to try and rectify the situation. It maintains that the allegations in the lawsuit are false.
Critics of the deal have accused CEO Elon Musk of using his outsized influence to manipulate the board’s vote on the 2016 takeover. Others have dubbed the deal a “bailout” of SolarCity, a company that Musk’s cousin founded, and never came close to turning a profit.
Tesla Inc shares rose $4.72 (+1.83%) in premarket trading Thursday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -17.21%, versus a -2.24% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Analyst: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Model 3 Production Must Increase Or Ability For New Funding Gets Tougher
body:
It has been a challenging week for shareholders of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA), as a steady stream of bad news has done a number on share prices. According to Morgan Stanley, there may be even more volatility to come for Tesla. more
CNBC shares the firm’s take on Tesla.
Tesla must quickly improve its Model 3 production rate if it wants to raise critically needed funds from investors at a decent price, according to Morgan Stanley.
The firm reiterated its equal weight rating on Tesla shares. The note came a day after the stock declined 8 percent on a negative analyst report and the National Transportation Safety Board’s announcement that it sent investigators to look into the fatal crash of a Tesla car last week. Moody’s also downgraded Tesla’s credit ratings after the close Tuesday.
Analyst Adam Jonas is sticking to his $379 price target for Tesla, but he pulled no punches in a note to clients. “A sharp drop in Tesla’s share price in part reflects questions on Model 3 ramp … an event that directly impacts both the company’s near-term cash needs and ability to potentially access the market for capital,” he wrote.
As he sees it, the company needs to ramp up production to place the current concerns in the rear view mirror, but he notes there may be some pain ahead if Tesla fails to do that. “A lower share price begets a lower share price… For a company widely expected to continue to fund its strategy through external capital raises, a fall in the share price can take on a self-fulfilling nature that further exacerbates the volatility of the share price,” he added.
Tesla Inc shares fell $0.23 (-0.09%) in after-hours trading Wednesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -17.21%, versus a -2.24% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Moody’s Lowers Tesla Inc (TSLA) Credit Rating
body:
For the most part, Wall Street seems to have shrugged off production issues that may come up along the way for Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA). However, those issues may finally be catching up with Tesla, especially when combined with concerns over the company’s cash burn rate.  more
As Bloomberg explains, Moody’s Investors Service has reacted to the concerns surrounding Tesla.
Tesla Inc.’s credit rating was downgraded by Moody’s Investors Service on Tuesday as the electric car company burns through cash, fails to meet production expectations and may soon have to raise more than $2 billion.
Moody’s cut Tesla’s overall rating to B3, or six levels below investment grade, from B2 and said its outlook on the company is negative. Tesla’s $1.8 billion of senior unsecured notes, issued in August, were downgraded to Caa1, seven steps into junk, from B3.
No comment has been forthcoming from Tesla on Moody’s concerns and downgrade. In his report, Moody’s analyst Bruce Clark called specific attention to the problems that have led to Tesla’s rating being dropped.
“Tesla’s ratings reflect the significant shortfall in the production rate of the company’s Model 3 electric vehicle,” Clark wrote. “The company also faces liquidity pressures due to its large negative free cash flow and the pending maturities.”
Tesla Inc shares fell $4.68 (-1.68%) in premarket trading Wednesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -10.33%, versus a -1.95% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of D (Sell), and is ranked #16 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: NTSB Investigating Fatal Tesla Inc (TSLA) Model X Crash
body:
The U.S. National Transportation Safety Board is preparing to investigate a fatal crash involving a Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) Model X vehicle in California. The news rattled Tesla shareholders, and share prices suffered as part of a broader market sell-off.   more
Electrek shares the details on the fatal Tesla crash.
Last week, a Tesla Model X driver died of due to injuries after his vehicle caught on fire in a crash on the highway in the Bay Area.
Today, the U.S. National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) announced that they are sending 2 investigators to conduct a “Field Investigation” of the accident.
The California Highway Patrol has reported that the vehicle struck the median barrier and quickly caught on fire before being hit by a pair of other vehicles. The NTSB is trying to get to the bottom of what happened, and the agency notes that it’s “unclear if automated control system was active at the time of the crash.”
“We have been deeply saddened by this accident, and we have offered our full cooperation to the authorities as we work to establish the facts of the incident,” said a spokesperson for Tesla.
Tesla Inc shares fell $0.68 (-0.24%) in after-hours trading Tuesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -10.33%, versus a -1.95% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #8 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Long-Awaited Tesla Inc (TSLA) Navigation Update Coming Later This Week
body:
Tesla Inc’s (NASDAQ:TSLA) navigation system has left a lot to be desired in the eyes of consumers for several years, but it looks like that’s finally about to change. CEO Elon Musk assures Tesla loyalists that an update is on the way this week. more
CNET has the details on Tesla’s update.
Musk also said in his tweet that this should be treated as a “mature beta,” but that functionality should improve rapidly. Electrek has been posting about these updates since a Tesla hacker friend of the site, known as verygreen, discovered the code for the new system in their car last summer.
The new navigation software will feature greatly improved routing as well as much more legible maps thanks to a new feature called “Vector Maps.” The software is of Tesla’s own design but relies on modules from MapBox and Valhalla, open-source mapping and routing programs, respectively.
Musk explained to followers that Tesla has been relying on third-party software for the systems, and that meant the company’s hands were tied when it came to updates and tweaking things. He promises that problem is a thing of the past, but he cautions there may still be some kinks to work through.
“New nav starts rolling out this weekend. Should be considered a mature beta at first, so won’t be perfect, but will improve rapidly,” Musk shared. “With the old system, we were stuck with legacy 3rd party black box code and stale data. No way to improve.”
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $295.66 per share on Tuesday morning, down $8.52 (-2.80%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -5.04%, versus a -0.30% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #8 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Wall Street Sharks Are Circling Tesla Inc (TSLA) Junk Bonds
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) shares re-entered bear market territory recently, plunging 20% from their yearly highs.more
But the heavily-shorted stock isn’t the only target for traders looking to profit from the electric automaker’s decline. As CNBC reports, Tesla’s corporate junk bonds are also seeing plenty of action:
Investors are betting against Tesla’s bonds amid growing worries about the electric car maker’s ability to deliver on its production goals, given significant delays for the Model 3.
“While equity short sellers continue to hang around, shorts in the most liquid TSLA bond have made a tidy profit so far in 2018,” Sam Pierson, director, securities finance, at IHS Markit said in a Monday note. “They have not covered to lock in the profit, suggesting that they think the credit will continue to deteriorate.”
Pierson noted that 99% of lendable supply for Tesla’s junk bonds has been used. That’s sent the cost of new net short positions to the highest level on record.
Tesla has issued several rounds of high-yield bonds in order to raise cash and expand production of its Model 3 sedan, which still lags well behind schedule. Critics worry that rising competition in the EV space, combined with production delays, could lead to consumers simply looking elsewhere for their next vehicle.
Tesla Inc shares rose $2.80 (+0.92%) in premarket trading Tuesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -2.30%, versus a -0.26% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #7 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Runs Into Delivery Issues In Norway
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has been running into troubles dealing with deliveries in Norway due to logistical issues. In response, CEO Elon Musk has encouraged the company to tap the brakes and slow things down when it comes to Norway deliveries.  more
CNBC has the details on Tesla’s delivery woes.
Tesla has been instructed to “slow down” on car deliveries in Norway this quarter, CEO Elon Musk said on Saturday, in response to woes the company has experienced delivering their vehicles.
On Twitter, Musk replied to a report stating that Tesla shipments in the country have been subject to accidents on the roads. The publication, called Electrek, said the car maker has had trouble finding “competent transporters” to deliver batches of cars, something a Tesla representative said the company was working to address.
Electric vehicles are quite popular in the country, and residents are said to be big fans of Tesla’s offerings. Last year, more than half of new vehicle registrations in the country were for electric or hybrid vehicles. Musk took to Twitter to explain why the company has to slow things down for the time being.
“It is clear that we are exceeding the local logistics capacity due to batch build and delivery,” Musk wrote in part. “Customer happiness & safety matter more than a few extra cars this quarter.”
Tesla Inc shares rose $4.96 (+1.64%) in premarket trading Monday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -3.15%, versus a -2.91% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: How Tesla Inc (TSLA) Could Compensate Elon Musk To The Tune Of $55 Billion
body:
A source close to Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) leaked some interesting details about CEO Elon Musk’s massive compensation plan recently.more
The unidentified person, who was present at a recent board meeting, noted that Musk would earn more than $50 billion in compensation over the next several years — if Tesla hits certain milestones. CNBC has more details:
The grant gives Musk $2.6 billion in stock options in 12 tranches that each vest as the company hits key performance milestones over 10 years.
Musk needs to hit 12 market capitalization milestones and 16 revenue or earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization targets in order to vest the entire award. Tesla has to reach a market cap of $100 billion for the first tranche to vest, and then each of the remaining 11 tranches require an additional $50 billion in market value.
Other milestones necessary for the full value of the deal to materialize are growing revenue from $20 billion currently to $175 billion, and various EBITDA milestones that range up to $14 billion.
In total, Musk could earn a whopping $55.8 billion in stock and awards, provided that Tesla’s market cap soars to $650 billion from $53 billion currently.
Tesla Inc shares closed at $301.54 on Friday, down $7.56 (-2.45%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -3.15%, versus a -2.91% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #7 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Big Executives May Be Leaving, But Tesla Inc (TSLA) Is A Top Job Destination
body:
A few top executives have decided to move on from Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA), but that’s not hampering the company’s standing in the eyes of job seekers. Tesla has taken down one of the top spots on LinkedIn’s recent ranking of hot spots for prospective employees. more
Teslarati has the details on where Tesla ranked in comparison to other top companies.
Tesla has made it to LinkedIn’s list of top companies that American professionals want to work for, placing 5th and outranking massive firms such as Apple and The Walt Disney Company. Companies who were considered in LinkedIn’s rankings were evaluated based on factors such as job seekers’ interest and engagement with the company, as well as job demand and employee retention.
Tesla comes on the heels of massive companies such as Amazon (#1), Google (#2), Facebook (#3), and Salesforce (#4), which dominate the top of LinkedIn’s list. Daniel Roth, editor-in-chief of LinkedIn, noted that Tesla’s bold style in the electric car industry seems to have become very attractive to job applicants across the country. Over the course of 2017, LinkedIn tracked 500,000 job applicants to the Elon Musk-led company.
Tesla reached a number of significant milestones last year, and that could be a big part of the appeal for applicants. The company unveiled the electric Tesla semi, which could very well disrupt the long-haul industry, and also debuted the world’s largest lithium-ion battery in South Australia, among other accomplishments.
LinkedIn also called attention to the company’s favorable practices in the eyes of employees, as the environment appears to encourage autonomy as opposed to micro-managing every step of the way.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $305.67 per share on Friday morning, down $3.43 (-1.11%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -1.82%, versus a -0.65% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Preparing For Model 3 Launch In Canada
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) accelerated the launch of its Model 3 in Canada earlier this year, and it looks like the company is on schedule to make that happen. Invites have been sent out for configuration to Canadian customers, and the starting price for customers North of the border has been confirmed to boot.   more
Electrek has the details on Tesla’s plans for the Model 3 in Canada.
Tesla is finally starting to launch the Model 3 outside of the US for the first time – starting in Canada as previously announced.
The automaker is starting to send invites for configuration this week and it confirmed the Canadian price. Earlier this year, Tesla accelerated the planned launch of the Model 3 in Canada from “late 2018” to “mid 2018”.
Tesla has confirmed that the starting price of the Model 3 in Canada will be $45,600 CAD, which is roughly $350 more than the price for US consumers. Assuming timelines are similar for US and Canadian customers, deliveries could start as soon as next month.
The automaker has confirmed that the first batch of invites to configure have been sent out.
Tesla Inc shares fell $3.28 (-1.04%) in premarket trading Thursday. Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 0.53%, versus a 0.75% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Shareholders Approve Massive Compensation Package For CEO Elon Musk
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) can cross at least one item off of its lengthy to-do list. The debate over whether or not to award CEO Elon Musk with a hefty compensation package has come to a close, as shareholders have weighed in with the final word.  more
Bloomberg has the news on the decision from Tesla shareholders.
Tesla Inc. shareholders approved the board’s proposal to grant Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk stock options valued at $2.6 billion, paving the way for him to reap a big windfall if the electric-car maker maintains its growth trajectory over the next decade.
Investors holding a majority of the shares that were voted at Wednesday’s special meeting in Fremont, California, supported the performance award, a person with knowledge of the results said. The board needed majority approval to make the grant, which likely is the largest one-time compensation deal ever awarded. Tesla had said Musk and his brother Kimbal, who’s a company director, wouldn’t vote their shares.
The comp plan for Musk is tied directly to the company achieving its ambitious financial goals. In order for Musk’s options to fully vest, Tesla would have to become worth $650 billion, which would make it larger than Facebook, and produce more on the revenue front than Procter & Gamble.
Advocates of the plan believe that the award will ultimately help Musk to drive the business even further ahead, but critics are confused as to why he would need even more equity to stay properly focused on Tesla’s goals.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $316.53 per share on Wednesday afternoon, up $5.98 (+1.93%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 1.66%, versus a 1.33% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Report: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Eyeing AI Partnership For Self-Driving Tech
body:
Rumors are making the rounds that Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) is in talks with an Israeli-based AI startup called Cortica, which specializes in technology for autonomous cars. However, CEO Elon Musk has hopped on Twitter to throw cold water on those claims. more
BGR shares the scuttlebutt making the rounds about Tesla.
Interestingly enough, Musk recently traveled to Israel where he reportedly met with an Israeli-based AI startup called Cortica. Musk’s visit with Cortica is particularly intriguing given that the company specializes in AI for autonomous cars. Citing one person who claims to be familiar with the matter, Globes relays that the purpose of Musk’s visit is to examine the feasibility of incorporating Cortica’s technology into Tesla vehicles.
As to why Tesla is taking a keen interest in Cortica, the report notes that the company “is developing unsupervised machine learning systems that can understand a vehicle’s environment and identify objects while the vehicle is travelling.”
According to a note on Cortica’s website, the company’s autonomous AI technology “enables the vehicle to identify the moving parts in its environment and make informed decisions- even predicting the changes likely to occur in its surroundings.” After the story gained some considerable traction, Musk chimed in to refute it.
“This is completely false. Never even heard of Cortica,” Musk wrote. “Just taking my kids on a Spring Break trip to see ancient historical sites in Israel & Jordan.”
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $317.46 per share on Wednesday morning, up $6.91 (+2.23%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 1.96%, versus a 1.54% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Bear Market May Be Looming For Tesla Inc (TSLA) Share Prices
body:
Since reaching an all-time high last September, shares of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) have dropped more than 20 percent. Concerns over production continue to linger around the company, and the stock is teetering on the edge of bear market territory as a result. more
CNBC has additional insight into Tesla’s share prices.
Tesla shares are sinking into bear-market territory, as investors worry the company may not hit a key production milestone.
The stock was recently trading at around $310, which is more than 20 percent below its all-time high of $389.61, set in September 2017. To be in a bear-market territory, a sign of very negative investor sentiment, the shares would need to close at $311.69 or lower.
At the top of the list of investor concerns are worries that the company is going to miss the boat on Model 3 production goals. The enthusiasm over the new model was partially behind the stock’s run-up to all-time highs, but signs continue to point to Q1 production goals being missed.
“There is a growing consensus that they are going to miss their Model 3 production forecast for the first quarter,” CFRA analyst Efraim Levy said in an interview with CNBC.
Tesla Inc shares rose $0.35 (+0.11%) in premarket trading Wednesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -0.26%, versus a 1.53% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Pushing Down Towards Key Technical Levels
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) share prices are heading towards key technical levels. Analyst Nigam Arora has done some digging into the charts to make sense of things, and he’s passed along what he found. more
Marketwatch shares Arora’s take on Tesla.
The chart shows Tesla Whac-a-Mole. Lately when there is bad news for Tesla, buyers step in around $300, often driving the stock higher. In the past month, investors drove the stock to $357.
The chart shows that Tesla’s stock is below the 200-day moving average. There is no magic by itself to the 200-day moving average. However, many investors believe that a stock trading below that level is bearish. Sometimes this belief on the part of a large number of investors becomes a self-fulfilling prophecy.
Arora points out that volume has been spiking on down days for Tesla, which he points to as a clear bearish signal. He adds that Tesla seems to trade based on technicals and sentiment while fundamentals are essentially dismissed by investors.
It’ll be interesting to see if Tesla pushes all the way down through the $300 price point, as Arora notes that it appears to be a key psychological level for the company’s share price.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $310.15 per share on Tuesday afternoon, down $3.41 (-1.09%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -0.39%, versus a 1.49% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Previous Owners Didn't Jump On Tesla Inc's (TSLA) Model 3
body:
While Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) takes plenty of hits for its various hiccups in the production of its vehicles, some fans give the company a pass while pointing to the brand loyalty that Tesla inspires. Based on some recent findings by Bernstein Research, that line of thinking may be due for some closer examination.   more
Marketwatch shares Bernstein’s findings on Tesla.
Tesla Inc. fans have waited a long time for the chance to buy the electric-car company’s Model 3 sedan, but an analyst said Monday that many didn’t jump at their first chance to buy one.
Bernstein Research analyst Toni Sacconaghi Jr. said among that the most recent group of reservation holders to receive purchasing privileges — existing owners of the company’s previous cars, the Model S and Model X — less than 30% opted to configure and purchase the car when given the chance. That was just the second group to receive access to purchase a Model 3, after Tesla employees.
Tesla is betting big that the Model 3 will be a huge hit, and Chief Executive Elon Musk has touted that the company received 455,000 reservations as of late last year. That said, many deposits are refundable at this stage of the game, as not all reservation-holders have been locked in with configurations for the vehicles.
“If correct, this take rate would be substantially worse than predicted by our July 2017 survey, which had indicated that up to 69% of S/X owners with reservations were likely/very likely to take delivery of their Model 3,” Sacconaghi noted.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $311.30 per share on Tuesday morning, down $2.26 (-0.72%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -0.02%, versus a 1.49% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc's (TSLA) Powerwall Plant In Australia Hits Roadblock
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) reached a major deal with the South Australia government earlier this year for what would be the world’s biggest virtual power plant. Fast forward to today, and a changing of the guard has led to a wrench being thrown into Tesla’s plans. more
Electrek has the news on a new problem that Tesla is faced with.
Earlier this year, Tesla announced that it reached a deal with the South Australian government to install solar arrays and Powerwalls on 50,000 homes to create the biggest virtual power plant in the world.
Now, new Premier of South Australia, Steven Marshall, a member of the Liberal party who just replaced the Labor party this week, made his intention clear that his administration doesn’t plan to go through with the rest of Tesla’s plan.
While Marshall’s announcement doesn’t mean the project will be coming to a screeching halt, he’s not interested in advancing things beyond what the previous administration has already approved. “We don’t have any plans to stop what they have signed up to but we certainly don’t have any plans whatsoever to change one single component of our energy solution,” eh said.
The deal was touted as eventually reaching 50,000 homes, but only 1,100 installations were actually secured with funding by the previous administration.
Tesla Inc shares rose $0.94 (+0.30%) in premarket trading Tuesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 0.71%, versus a 1.36% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Goldman Sachs Stands By Sell Call For Tesla Inc (TSLA)
body:
For the most part, concerns about Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) being behind schedule are met with shrugs up and down the street. However, Goldman Sachs is more concerned than most, and the firm is reiterating its bearish stance on Tesla as a result.  more
CNBC passes along the firm’s prediction on Tesla’s share price.
Tesla’s troubles manufacturing the Model 3 are far from over, according to a top Wall Street firm.
Goldman analyst David Tamberrino reaffirmed his sell rating for Tesla shares, predicting Model 3 deliveries will come in below expectations.
In a note to clients, Tamberrino pointed to what the firm believes will be a “slow ramp” for the Model 3. The firm estimates that just 7,000 will be delivered in the first quarter, well below the consensus estimate of 13,800. Tamberrino sees Tesla’s share price taking a hit as a result, and he’s holding firm on his $205 six-month price target.
“We continue to expect a slow ramp for the Model 3, and maintain our Sell rating as we expect shares to de-rate as targets are potentially pushed further out,” he wrote.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $311.05 per share on Monday afternoon, down $10.30 (-3.21%). Year-to-date, TSLA has declined -0.10%, versus a 0.96% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Could Benefit Most From Potential EV Tax Credit Cap Reform
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has been a big beneficiary of electric vehicle tax credits at home and abroad.more
Considering it only builds electric vehicles, every car it’s sold to this point has come with a juicy government-subsidized discount. In the U.S., this comes in the form of a federal tax credit.
But Tesla is about to hit cap for these credits, if it hasn’t already. The results could be massive for its business, as consumers may simply buy an EV from another company instead to reap the full tax reward.
However, as Electrek reports, there’s a new push to do away with the cap, and extend EV credits indefinitely:
Some politicians and electric utilities are now pushing the idea to remove the cap of 200,000 electric vehicles sold per manufacturer in order to get access to the federal tax credit just as Tesla and GM are about to hit the threshold.
In the US, like in several other countries around the world, the federal government has long been offering an incentive for car buyers to buy electric vehicles in order to represent the value those vehicles have for the environment over gas-powered vehicles.
Democratic U.S. Senator Jeff Merkley of Oregon is leading the charge to remove the cap, and he has the backing of 36 major electric utilities as well. It’ll be interesting to see how the situation plays out, considering the GOP recently wanted to do away with the EV credit, while Democrats clearly want to extend it significantly.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Employees Say Flawed Parts Are Affecting Production
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has come to be known for putting forth ambitious timelines for its offerings and then struggling mightily to reach them, and that’s led to plenty of questions as to why that’s the case. According to sources, flawed parts are a huge part of the problem. moreCNBC has the scoop on where some current and former employees of Tesla are pointing their fingers.
Luxury automaker Tesla is manufacturing a surprisingly high ratio of flawed parts and vehicles, according to several current and former employees, leading to more rework and repairs than can be contained at its factory in Fremont, California.
Tesla’s future as a mass-market carmaker hinges on efficient, automated production of the Model 3, which more than 400,000 people have already reserved, paying $1,000 refundable fees to do so. Musk said in July 2017 that Tesla would probably be making 20,000 Model 3s per month by December.
According to one current engineer at the company’s Fremont factory, a staggering 40 percent of the parts made or received at the factory require some sort of rework. Other employees have hit similar notes, and that’s leading to an inability to hit goals, which is in turn hampering employee morale.
A spokesperson for Tesla has denied the claims noting “Our remanufacturing team does not ‘rework’ cars.”
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $326.80 per share on Wednesday afternoon, down $15.04 (-4.40%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 4.96%, versus a 3.08% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #8 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Tesla Inc's (TSLA) Model 3 Production Is Veering Off Course, But Markets May Respond With Shrugs
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has a tendency to shoot for the moon when it comes to production goals for its models, but that doesn’t translate into the company actually being able to achieve those goals. The same scenario appears to be playing out with the Model 3, but there’s a good chance the markets will continue to just shrug it off.  more
Business Insider has the news on how Tesla may miss the mark on Model 3.
This is hardly shocking. The entire Model 3 rollout has been, to put it mildly, a mess. But so what? The Model S rollout wasn’t exactly perfect, and the first six months of Model X SUV production introduced the Teslarati to Elon Musk’s favorite term — “production hell” — and found the CEO sleeping on the floor of his Fremont, CA factory.
Musk once said that Tesla would be selling 500,000 vehicles by the end of 2018. The Model 3 would have accounted for roughly 400,000 of that ambitious total (Model S and X assembly is likely capped at around 100,000 annually). I’m happy to be proven wrong here, but I don’t think Tesla is going to make it.
By the end of this month, production of the Model 3 is supposed to be at 2,500 per week. According to Bloomberg estimates, the number will be closer to 1,000. For other automakers, that would be a huge red flag that impacted share prices, but Tesla investors have continually shown a willingness to look past the company’s tendency to overestimate its own capabilities.
We’ll have to wait and see if the same thing happens this time around, but history points to it being a safe bet.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $335.54 per share on Wednesday morning, down $6.30 (-1.84%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 7.77%, versus a 3.87% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Supercharger Customers Hit With Price Increase
body:
Pain at the pump and driving a Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) vehicle don’t exactly go hand-in hand, but that doesn’t mean that Tesla owners don’t feel a strain on their wallets pretty regularly. In fact, that strain is about to become even more noticeable in the wake of a recent price increase at the company’s network of charging stations.     more
The Verge has the details on Tesla’s price bump.
Tesla drivers may enjoy a vast network of Supercharger stations across the US, but it’s coming at a cost: the price of charging. The automaker has quietly raised prices per kilowatt hour for using the fast-charging stations.
The average increase for pay-per-use customers ranges from roughly 20 to 40 percent, according to Electrek. In California, for example, the price went from 20 cents per kWh to 26 cents. In Oregon, the price doubled from 12 cents to 24 cents, and New York’s went up five cents to 24 cents per kWh. Owners of new Model S and Model X vehicles continue to have 400kWh of credit per year, while Model 3 drivers have no credits.
Across North America, there are more than 1,100 Supercharging stations. Tesla ownership is slated to increase dramatically this year, and that will put additional strain on the network itself.
In a note on its Supercharger website, the company notes that the stations “will never be a profit center.”
Tesla Inc shares rose $0.44 (+0.13%) in premarket trading Tuesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 10.97%, versus a 4.37% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Geneva Motor Show Underscores Increasing Competition On Way For Tesla Inc (TSLA)
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has little trouble dominating the headlines when it comes to futuristic vehicles, but that doesn’t mean it’s the only company with some exciting plans in the works. The recent Geneva Auto Show helped to crystallize exactly how crowded the market is about to get. more
The Verge shares the details on some exciting competitors that should have Tesla looking over its shoulder.
The difference with this particular show, more than others past, is that it was filled to the brim with clear, serious competitors to Tesla. And I don’t just mean direct comparisons, with cars like the Jaguar I-Pace, which matches up almost spec for spec to something like the entry-level Model X. The show was also dominated by cars that slot into the parts of the market that Tesla thrives in. More luxury EVs and hybrids are coming than ever before, and for the rest of us, there are now multiple cheaper options for something other than the Model 3.
The I-Pace is open for orders with delivery scheduled for the second half of this year, and it comes in at a lower starting price point than several Tesla models to boot. Porsche was also at the show to showcase its upcoming plans, as were names such as Audi, Hyundai, and BMW.
In short, those in the market for an EV or hybrid vehicle are about to have a ton of options to sort through, and that news should put a little pep in the step of Tesla to insure it meets timelines with its latest models.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $333.80 per share on Monday morning, up $6.63 (+2.03%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 7.21%, versus a 4.86% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Noted Tesla Inc (TSLA) Analyst Points To Amazon As Potential Major Threat
body:
It seems like just about every company out there is worried about what Amazon is up to these days, and it looks like we may want to add Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) to that lengthy list. That’s the word from noted Tesla analyst Adam Jonas of Morgan Stanley, who has offered up some insight into his feelings on the potential threat that may be looming down the road.     more
CNBC passes along what Jonas had to say in a note to clients.
“We expect that Tesla will successfully overcome bottlenecks and ramp Model 3 production throughout 2018. The boost to cash flow and sentiment provides a selling opportunity before facing further headwinds,” analyst Adam Jonas wrote in a note to clients Friday.
“Where we have substantially higher conviction on the Tesla story is our longer term thesis that the company will face greater levels of competition than the market anticipates in the domains of electric vehicles, autonomous vehicles, and shared mobility.”
For Amazon specifically, Jonas added that the company “has a vested interest in taking the marginal cost of transportation to its lowest possible level.” While that doesn’t mean that the tech giant will jump head first into logistics, Jonas points to “the scale that large e-commerce players can bring, which could lead to surprisingly deflationary long-term trends in some of Tesla’s core initiatives.”
Morgan Stanley maintains its equal weight rating for Tesla, and the firm is sticking to its $379 price target.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $324.28 per share on Friday morning, down $4.82 (-1.46%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 4.15%, versus a 3.73% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Loses Yet Another Key Executive
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) continues to make impressive strides in its quest for dominance in the electric vehicle market, but the company is having some trouble keeping the band together. The company has announced that another major executive is leaving the company. more
Bloomberg has the news on the latest Tesla executive to move on from the company.
Tesla Inc.’s chief accounting officer has left the company, the latest in a string of management departures from the electric-car maker.
Eric Branderiz, who also served as corporate controller, left Tesla for personal reasons on Wednesday, according to a regulatory filing. Tesla shares dropped as much as 1.9 percent after the close of regular trading.
Branderiz’s exit is just the latest in a string of high-level departures from the company, including Jon McNeill, president of global sales and service. Besides McNeill, the company has also lost Chief Financial Officer Jason Wheeler, Kurt Kelty, director of battery technology, and Diarmuid O’Connell, vice president of business development.
Next month, shareholders will have to decide on a $2.6 billion equity award for Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk, which is designed to help keep him with the company for the long term.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Model S Enthusiasts Itching For Upgrades
body:
While the Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) Model S has had little trouble winning fans since its release in 2012, some enthusiasts are hoping for a redesign of the car they’ve grown to love. A recent thread popped up on Reddit that outlined some of the items that are at the top of the list.   more
Business Insider has the details on what customers are hoping to see from Tesla in the future.
Some Tesla fans and customers have taken this moment to speculate on what a redesigned version of the Model S might bring. In a Reddit thread titled, “Model S Refresh – what features are you expecting,” one user opened the discussion by asking other users what features a new version of the Model S would need to justify buying it over the Model 3, which starts at a little under half the $74,500 base price for the Model S.
While those who participated in the thread had a variety of requests, they seemed to converge on a few features: a redesigned interior, heads-up display, and a bigger battery.
Tesla has its hands full on a number of other projects these days, and there’s no sign that a redesign of the Model S will be in the offing anytime soon. That said, it’s valuable feedback for the automaker, which will obviously want to insure it’s hitting the right notes for luxury electric car shoppers.
As Autotrader executive editor Brian Moody explains, progress that has been made on the company’s Model 3 has not been lost on buyers in that market. “What luxury buyers don’t want is to have something where the less expensive car is … ‘nicer,'” he said.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $330.24 per share on Thursday morning, down $2.06 (-0.62%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 6.07%, versus a 2.52% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: First Tesla Inc (TSLA) Semi-Trucks Hit The Road
body:
Anticipation is high for Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) semi-trucks, which already have customers lining up for their targeted release in 2019. A notable production milestone has been reached, as the first of the trucks have left the Nevada Gigafactory for a road trip.  more
Ars Technica has the details on Tesla’s big news.
On Wednesday, Tesla CEO Elon Musk posted a picture on Instagram of two Tesla Semis at the Sparks, Nevada Gigafactory. The trucks are apparently full of battery packs and are making their way to the Tesla factory in Fremont, California.
“First production cargo trip of the Tesla Semi heavy-duty truck, carrying battery packs from the Gigafactory in the Nevada mountains to the car factory in California,” Musk wrote.
Tesla announced the electric big rigs last November, and companies such as Walmart and DHL are reportedly interested. The company has projected that they’ll be ready for sale in 2019, but Tesla has noted that they’ll be used internally first, presumably as a means of working out potential kinks before they hit the market.
There’s no word on whether the trucks will be making the full round trip on a single charge or if there will need to be a pit stop for charging purposes.

heading: Survey Says Big Surge In Tesla Inc (TSLA) Model 3 Sales Coming Soon
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) already has hundreds of thousands of people waiting in line to buy a Model 3 electric sedan.more
The would-be owners have plunked down a $1,000 deposit for the chance to own the new EV, which is still being produced in extremely limited quantities. Tesla hopes to ramp up production of the $35,000 car later this year after several months of delays.
Now, as Inverse reports, that initial price tag may not reflect consumers’ true demand for the automobile, according to famous Wall Street analyst Gene Munster:
Munster’s firm, Loup Ventures, “surveyed 519 people in the U.S. regarding interest in buying a Tesla Model 3… [and] found a surprisingly high number (17 percent) of people would buy a Model 3 at $40,000. Even if this survey is off by [a factor of three], the results still imply significant market share gains are in store for Tesla given their current U.S. unit market share is below 0.5 percent.”
Munster noted his long-term forecast is for Tesla to own 17% of the U.S. auto market. However, that will take 10 years or more to achieve.
In the meantime, the automaker should make up around 1.5% of the total U.S. auto sales by the end of 2019 — with plenty of additional speed bumps along the way.

heading: Proxy Group Cries Foul On Tesla Inc's (TSLA) Board Over Musk Comp
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) may grant CEO Elon Musk a massive stock reward for his efforts, but a proxy advisory firm is requesting a closer examination of that generosity. Glass Lewis has expressed a number of concerns about the proposal, including that it seems to skew Musk’s value in relation to other executive compensation packages. more
Reuters has the details on the recommendations from Glass Lewis.
Influential proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis said Tesla Inc (TSLA.O) shareholders should vote against a proposal to grant Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk performance-based stock options worth about $2.62 billion.
If Musk earned the full grant, he would own 28.3 percent of the company, although Tesla’s proxy statement showed that his ownership was expected to be lesser, Glass Lewis said in a report dated Feb. 28.
The proxy firm used a different valuation model when taking a look at the award, and it estimates it would actually be worth a whopping $3.7 billion. According to the firm, “the cost of the grant is staggering relative to executive compensation levels among public companies worldwide.”
Glass Lewis is also concerned that the proposed award to Musk would dilute the company’s other investors.
Tesla Inc shares rose $2.15 (+0.64%) in premarket trading Tuesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 7.07%, versus a 2.00% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.

heading: Elon Musk Says New Tesla Inc (TSLA) Navigation System Is "Almost Done"
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk revealed on Twitter over the weekend that his company’s much-anticipated update to its in-car navigation app is nearly complete.more
Electrek has more details on the long-awaited update, which promises to bring significant improvements over the current system:
We have been reporting on details of Tesla’s new in-house navigation and maps engine for the better part of a year now and back in December, CEO Elon Musk said that it was ‘light years ahead’ of the current system and coming in ‘early 2018’.
Now a few months into 2018, Musk says that the upgrade is ‘almost done’.
The new system is appropriately dubbed “Tesla Maps,” and relies on a vector graphics-based system for smooth visuals. These improvements reportedly make for more detailed maps and overall less laggy performance.
Elon Musk also noted that his software team was laser focused on improving the Model 3 sedan’s software right now. That system still isn’t anywhere near completion, despite the fact that the company started producing the cars back in July.

heading: Greece To Provide R&D Facility At Zero Cost To Tesla Inc (TSLA)
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has long benefitted from EV tax breaks from various world governments, but now one European country is taking accommodation to a whole new level.more
As The Guardian reports, a prominent Greek businessman is offering a massive facility for Tesla’s use at no cost whatsoever:
Tesla’s plans for the country have such “game-changing potential” that the head of the Hellenic Entrepreneurs’ Association, Vasilis Apostolopoulos, has pledged to hand over his own industrial plant for free as a testing ground for new products.
Addressing delegates at the annual Delphi economic forum, Apostolopoulos said: “I have personally emailed Musk to welcome Tesla Greece … and to say that for the next 10 years I will give, at zero cost to his company, my group’s own industrial plant outside Corinth so that Greece can be on the frontline of global innovation.”
Three of Tesla’s top engineers that hail from Greece are reportedly planning to move back to Athens as part of the development. These talented workers include principal motor designer Konstantinos Laskaris, motor design engineer Konstantinos Bourchas, and staff motor design engineer Vasilis Papanikolaou.
“It is the least we can do to thank and welcome Mr Musk’s vote of confidence in Hellenic business, research and technology,” Apostolopoulos concluded.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA), Mercedes-Benz Set To Lock Horns Over Electric Trucks
body:
While Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) may be the beneficiary of most of the hype and press when it comes to electric trucks, other automakers are positioning themselves for a piece of what could be a rather large pie. Mercedes-Benz is one of the names at the top of the list, as the company has some ambitious plans of its own for the space.  more
Teslarati has the scoop on a battle that may be brewing between Tesla and Mercedes-Benz.
While Tesla Semi “leaks” and spy footage continue to emerge and drive up interest in Elon Musk’s upcoming, all-electric truck, other companies that already have a long history in the transportation industry have been plugging away at making electric trucks, including on-road test models and, in some cases, production models that are already being built and sold.
Chief among those competitors is Daimler, who has already put some electric trucks into production and has plans for many more. Daimler is also the world’s most prolific commercial truck maker with operations around the globe with brands such as FUSO, Freightliner, and Mercedes-Benz leading many markets for commercial vehicle sales.
Tesla has been touting its plans to roll out electric trucks by 2019, but Mercedes-Benz has cast shade on those claims. Mercedes-Benz is working on its own electric big rig models, but the company has indicated that the tech has only advanced so far at this stage of the game.
Regardless of who gets to market first, it’s quite clear that there’s big interest in electric big rigs, and that should lead to plenty of jockeying for market share.

heading: Porsche Is About To Give Tesla Inc (TSLA) Some Major Charging Network Competition
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has been the king of EVs in the United States for the past few years, with its fast cars and growing Supercharger network giving it a major leg up on the competition.more
But as Ars Technica reports, those factors are about to change:
Porsche and other members of the Volkswagen Group will build out a network of fast-charging infrastructure in Europe and here in the US. Right at the beginning of the project, it was decided the Mission E would use an 800V electrical architecture to allow for rapid recharging—250 miles in less than 20 minutes being the plan. In Europe, VW Group is working with other OEMs in a consortium to make that happen, but here in the US it will go it alone.
Along with the fast-growing charging network, Porsche will also roll out a the Mission E — a sleek four-door sedan that will deliver 600hp (447kW) and 310 miles (500km) of range from a 95kWh battery pack. That’ll make it the first real worthy adversary on the market for the Tesla Model S. Mission E is due out later this year.
Clearly, other automakers are lining up to beat Tesla at its own game. It’ll be very interesting to see if Tesla can handle the massive influx of EVs into the market — not to mention competitors’ charging stations as well.

heading: Production Quality Of Tesla Inc (TSLA) Called Into Question
body:
When examining the build quality of Tesla Inc’s (NASDAQ:TSLA) Model 3, first impressions have been generally positive. However, closer inspection points to room for improvement in the vehicle’s manufacturing processes. more
Business Insider‘s Matthew DeBord offers up his impression, which echo other early customer reviews.
Build quality is both general and specific. If you look at a Tesla vehicle, the overall impression is usually pretty good. They’re beautifully designed, with a vibe that’s classic and futuristic.
But if you focus, you may notice body panels that aren’t consistently spaced, known as “panel gaps.” Or misaligned door handles. Or interior plastic components that look really plasticky. Or upholstery that’s crinkled. Or other various minor components that aren’t up to snuff for a vehicle that can cost $100,000.
DeBord also calls out other inefficiencies he came across on the test vehicle, including steering-wheel stitching that seems to be a bit off. As Tesla has ramped up production through the years, overall build quality has also been on an upward trajectory.
However, it appears that there’s still some kinks to be worked out in the company’s overall manufacturing processes.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Dreams Of Epic Solar Roof Are Approaching Reality
body:
Back in January 2017, Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) revealed a bold ambition for its Gigafactory 1 in Nevada. Tesla noted that it wanted to construct “the world’s largest solar rooftop array” at the facility, and it looks like the company is starting to deliver on that promise.   more
Electrek has the details on Tesla’s progress towards yet another ambitious goal.
The Gigafactory 1 has a giant roof in the middle of the desert so it makes sense to install a giant solar array on top of it.
But a year after the announcement, there was no sign of a solar array at Tesla’s battery factory… until now.
The latest satellite imagery of the Gigafactory 1 construction site shows that solar panels are finally coming up on the north side of the factory.
All told, Tesla hopes to power the sprawling Gigafactory 1 entirely from renewable energy. The massive planned 70 MW rooftop array is a huge step towards making that happen, and it would take down the crown of largest of its kind in the world upon completion.
Tesla also has a Gigafactory 2 in Buffalo. That plant, where they manufacture solar products with Panasonic, is powered by hydro-electricity.

heading: Market Size Expectations Are Climbing For Tesla Inc (TSLA) Semi-Trucks
body:
Anticipation is high for Tesla Inc’s (NASDAQ:TSLA) entry into the semi-truck market, but questions abound about how much interest there will actually be for the company’s electric big rigs. According to CEO Elon Musk, there’s going to be a whole lot of it.    more
Clean Technica has the details on the increasing expectations for Tesla’s semi-truck market size.
Then Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on the recent quarterly conference call that he thinks Tesla could end up selling 100,000 Tesla Semis a year (which is similar to the Model S + Model X total, by the way). I thought, “Hmm, maybe I’ll finally get to that story.”
Then a DHL exec came out and basically said that the low cost on the Tesla Semi blows the competition out of the water, earning back its extra cost compared to a conventional diesel semi truck in only 1½ years. Quite humorously, this came right after a Daimler truck exec claimed the Tesla specs broke the laws of physics. It appears DHL disagrees with its German neighbor. And maybe 100,000 Tesla Semi sales a year is a genuine possibility.
The thoughts from the DHL exec are quite telling and point to a huge opportunity for Tesla. Estimates have priced their upcoming rigs in the ballpark of $170,000 at the low end to $200,000 at the higher end of the spectrum, and a number of other shipping companies are certainly intrigued by what Tesla is offering.
That said, the company has had problems delivering on demand in the consumer marketplace, and it’s hard to imagine that enterprise consumers would be as understanding if the same thing comes to pass with its big rigs.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $358.09 per share on Monday morning, up $6.04 (+1.72%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 15.01%, versus a 3.56% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of B (Buy), and is ranked #4 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Buyers To Lose Big EV Tax Cut In 2018
body:
A major reason for new car buyers to target Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) for the past few years has been the availability of massive electric vehicle tax kickbacks, but that key benefit looks set to run out very soon.more
As CNN Money reports, the EV maker informed the public that those lucrative vouchers won’t be around much longer:
In an SEC filing early Friday, Tesla said it expects that it will hit the threshold of 200,000 U.S. sales at some time in 2018. That will lead to the beginning of the end of a federal tax credit for its customers.
For any automaker, the full tax credit for their customers ends a few months after it sells its 200,000th plug-in car in the United States. Once the full tax credit disappears, for the next six months, buyers get a $3,750 credit. Then it drops to $1,875 during the following six months.
General Motors issued a similar warning last week as well, so Tesla isn’t alone here. It’ll be very interesting to see how this news affects demand for Tesla’s products — especially the new (and much-delayed) Model 3, which starts at just $35,000. If most Model 3 buyers won’t in fact see much of a tax credit, if any at all, it could well lead to a wave of order cancellations.
Tesla Inc shares closed at $352.05 on Friday, up $5.88 (+1.70%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 13.07%, versus a 2.94% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of B (Buy), and is ranked #4 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Model S Outsells German Rivals In Europe For First Time
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has made a ton of headway in the U.S. upper-sedan market in recent years, and the same now applies to the other side of the Atlantic. The company’s Tesla Model S has just checked a significant milestone off of the to-do list over in Europe.   more
Automotive News Europe passes along the details on Tesla’s success.
Germany’s premium brands are under pressure to accelerate their plans for electric cars after Tesla’s Model S outsold the luxury flagships of Mercedes-Benz, BMW and Audi in Europe for the first time.
European sales of the Model S outstripped German premium brands’ range-topping sedans including the Mercedes S class and BMW 7 series.
Felipe Munoz, an analyst with JATO Dynamics, points to this news as “an alarm for the traditional automakers.” Consumers in Europe are showing increased interest in electric vehicles, and he worries that other companies are falling behind because they “can’t deliver on time.”
Last year, European sales of the Model S surged 30 percent to 16,132.
Tesla Inc shares rose $2.13 (+0.62%) in premarket trading Friday. Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 12.00%, versus a 1.90% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #9 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Daimler Casts Doubt On Tesla Inc's (TSLA) Semi-Truck Plans
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has a ton of ambitious plans on its docket, including a goal of producing a battery-powered semi-truck for delivery next year. A rival automaker has thrown shade on those plans while contending that it has a more realistic timetable for an electric big rig of its own.  more
Automotive News has the news on Daimler AG’s plans.
Daimler AG cast doubt on Tesla Inc.’s plan to deliver electric heavy trucks next year, saying its more modest goal to start selling battery-powered big rigs by 2021 is more realistic.
Daimler, best known for its luxury cars, is also the world’s biggest truckmaker, giving Daimler the most to lose should Tesla boss Elon Musk succeed in producing a semi-truck with a 500-mile range for delivery starting in 2019.
Martin Daum, head of trucks at Daimler, announced plans for trials of electric Mercedes-Benz trucks this year. Daimler has its sights set on mass production of the semi-trucks in 2021.
He notes that timelines can’t be increased based on current battery technology, and that “the same laws of physics apply” at both Daimler and Tesla’s respective home bases in Germany and California.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $344.85 per share on Thursday morning, up $11.55 (+3.47%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 10.76%, versus a 1.87% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #9 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Extends Delays For Model S And Model X, Citing High Demand
body:
Demand has been high for Tesla Inc’s (NASDAQ:TSLA) Model S and Model X types, and that’s creating a backlog. That’s the word from the automaker, which has extended the delays for both models. more
Electrek has additional details on the wrench that has been thrown in the company’s plans.
Tesla increased the delivery wait times for new orders of both vehicles – claiming that high demand is creating a backlog.
The time between a new Model S or Model X order and delivery has always been fluctuating and it is dependent on the buyer locations.
Customers in the market for a Model S or Model X can anticipate a four to five month wait time. Earlier this month, the company announced that the Model X would be delivered in June 2018, and the Model S was designated with the same time frame yesterday.
The announcement of the delay has sparked some speculation that the delay could be the result of a production line update or a design refresh, but a company spokesperson has cited the backlog created by high demand for the vehicles.
Tesla Inc shares rose $1.90 (+0.57%) in premarket trading Thursday. Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 7.05%, versus a 1.20% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #9 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Hackers Hit Tesla Inc (TSLA) Cloud To Mine Cryptos
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) is the latest big name company to have been victimized by hackers, but it doesn’t appear that the intruders were looking for sensitive data or customer information. Instead, the hackers hopped on Tesla’s cloud while on a quest for crytocurrency. more
The Verge passes along the news on the recently-discovered breach.
Tesla’s cloud account was hacked and used to mine cryptocurrency, according to a security research firm. Hackers gained access to the electric car company’s Amazon cloud account, where they were able to view “sensitive data” such as vehicle telemetry.
The researchers, who work for cybersecurity firm RedLock, discovered the breach last month while searching for which organization left credentials for an Amazon Web Services (AWS) account open to the public internet. The owner turned out to be Tesla.
RedLock reached out to Tesla right away, and the situation was immediately rectified. A spokesperson for Tesla quickly noted that no sensitive information was compromised before they patched up the hole.
Gaurav Kumar, RedLock’s CTO, notes that it’s becoming “far more lucrative” for cybercriminals to focus on hijacking computing power as opposed to data.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $338.05 per share on Wednesday morning, up $3.28 (+0.98%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 8.58%, versus a 2.27% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #10 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Model 3 Delays Spurring Brisk Chevy Bolt Sales
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) has created a vehicle in the Model 3 sedan that’s seeing no shortage of demand, but the fact that it simply can’t produce the car in any sort of mass quantities is giving its EV competitors a big advantage.more
As Reuters reports, would-be Tesla owners have taken to online forums to express their displeasure about repeated production delays, and GM dealers are reaping the benefits:
Last week Tesla told some holders of Model 3 reservations that they would not get their cars until 2019, eliciting howls of complaint on Tesla online fan forums. Tesla declined to comment.
GM dealers in California, the top U.S. market for electric vehicles, say brisk demand for Bolts is driven in part by frustrated Tesla buyers who are afraid they will lose a $7,500 electric vehicle tax credit if they wait. The tax credit drops in value and eventually disappears once Tesla sells 200,000 electric vehicles in the United States, which Edmunds analyst Jeremy Acevedo expects Tesla to hit by the fall.
Customers reportedly are disenfranchised with the long wait time to get a Model 3, and they want an affordable electric vehicle now. GM has stepped up to fill that gap with the suddenly popular Chevy Bolt, an all-electric subcompact. While not as roomy as the Model 3, which is a mid-sized sedan, the vehicle offers just about everything else a modern EV buyer would want.
Pricing of the cars is nearly identical, as is their battery range. The one key difference is, you can walk into a dealership and drive home in a brand new Bolt today. If you want a Model 3, you’ll need to wait at least a year to get your car — and possibly much longer.
Tesla Inc shares closed at $335.49 on Friday, up $1.43 (+0.43%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 7.75%, versus a 2.34% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #9 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Tesla Inc (TSLA) Continues To See Battery Traction With Public Utilities
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) appears set to strike a partnership with another public utility operator, this time in New York State.more
Teslarati has the details on a new proposal that would see a collaboration between Tesla and a key utility company that provides power to thousands of residents:
Orange and Rockland Utilities, a utility provider that is part of Consolidated Edison, Inc., recently submitted a proposal to collaborate with Tesla in the creation of a battery storage solution for New York residents. With the system in place, O&R expects its customers to see up to a 70% reduction in the demand charges on their electricity bills.
The Consolidated Edison utility provider submitted the proposal for the project on February 6 to the New York Public Service Commission. If the initiative does get approved, Tesla would be working closely with the utility provider to develop multi-use strategies that balance dispatch among stakeholder groups, including consumers who would be participating in the project.
O&R described exactly how the collaboration would work in a statement to the American Public Power Association. “These strategies will be guided by algorithms and protocols, designed by Tesla, to deliver optimal dispatch for the aggregated portfolio, maximizing the portfolio value among customers, the distribution grid, and Tesla. Under this demonstration, the flexible operating characteristics of distributed energy storage will be employed to obtain the highest value use of the resource at any point in time,” the organization noted.
Tesla has made significant progress with similar partnerships in Europe and Australia recently, particularly when pairing its batteries with green energy production like solar and wind power. The proposed collaboration between O&R and Tesla would earn some $788,000 annually, the organization noted, with 90% of those funds going to O&R and 10% going to Tesla.
Tesla Inc shares were trading at $334.70 per share on Friday morning, up $0.64 (+0.19%). Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 7.50%, versus a 2.23% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of C (Neutral), and is ranked #10 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.

heading: Bungled Model 3 Launch Leaves Door Open For Tesla Inc (TSLA) EV Competition
body:
Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) caused a major stir when it first announced a $35,000 electric vehicle packed with futuristic features.more
In fact, the Model 3 sedan has seen well over 500,000 pre-orders (which include a $1,000 refundable deposit) over the past year or so — despite the fact that almost no one has received their car yet.
Now, as Electrek reports, with the lower-priced configurations of the Model 3 still looking very far off, the door is open for competitors to step up and fill the void:
We have often discussed how electric cars in the $30,000 to $40,000 range weren’t on par with the Tesla Model 3, which led us to believe that those vehicles will have a tough time competing in the segment as the Model 3 becomes more widely available.
But with Tesla’s recent changes in the timeline for different and less expensive configurations, it has become clear that the Model 3 will not be available at a price point nowhere near $35,000 for almost the entire year, which could have a major impact in the EV market.
Potential alternatives to the Tesla Model 3 in the marketplace right now include the Chevy Bolt EV, the Hyundai Ioniq EV, and the new Nissan Leaf. The Leaf is expected to be available in higher volumes soon, and starts at $29,990 with a battery range of 151 miles.
The Leaf offers comparable options to the Model 3 that include Apple Carplay and Android Auto support, Alexa compatibility, a slick interface, and some autonomous driving features.
Tesla Inc shares were unchanged in premarket trading Tuesday. Year-to-date, TSLA has gained 1.41%, versus a -0.57% rise in the benchmark S&P 500 index during the same period.
TSLA currently has a StockNews.com POWR Rating of B (Buy), and is ranked #3 of 24 stocks in the Auto & Vehicle Manufacturers category.
